results.title: Chicago: land use growth and change
results.brief_description: “Summary: the first part of this film traces the phenomenal growth of chicago since its founding barely 150 years ago. its expansion is related to changing technology, particularly advancements in transport, and how these influenced the land use pattern of the city. dr. john blunden, of the open university, then discusses with professor brian berry, of the university of chicago, how the changing technology of the meat packing industry first resulted in the concentration of the world’s greatest stockyard complex in chicago- the union stockyards, and then how further changes led to its decline and dispersal throughout the western states of america”

results.title: Chicago transport: a case study
results.brief_description: “Summary: part of chicago’s transport system is formed by A Radial Network of Expressways. Besides increased accessibility these expressways have made an impact on surrounding land values and land use. the implications of this are discussed by the commissioner of public works for Chicago and the vice-chairman of the Chicago planning commission. the film compares the effects of two particular expressways (the john f. Kennedy and the edens) and then focuses on a new development along one of them- the edens plaza shopping precinct. introduced by dr. john blunden”

results.title: Chicago now: the better to see you
results.brief_description: An informal look at the city of Chicago. This photographic tour is hosted by some of the people who live in Chicago, and they talk about their favourite places in the city. The program gives a new insight into one of America’s largest cities

results.title: Chemicals in the Workplace
results.creator_credit: Kim Dalton and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: An informative program which lists harmful chemicals that are commonly used in industry. The dangerous effects that these chemicals may have on the human body, if not properly protected, are discussed and workers who have suffered from the adverse effects, of the chemicals, talk about their injuries.

results.title: Chelsea College
results.brief_description: This film concerns the theoretical and practical instruction received by students at the College of Aeronautics and Automobile Engineering in Chelsea, England, and the practical application of their highly skilled technical knowledge in many fields of present day life. The students coming from over forty-five different countries are divided into three training groups - automobile, aeronautical, and agricultural engineering. In addition to showing a good deal of detail of the training given, the film displays scenes of the student life out of the class-rooms.
